API Journey Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(6) API Journeys Inside-Out

  • APIs are used and well-known to IT specialists
  • APIs seems obscure and tech-only to many others
    • Move focus from technology to business for API initiatives
    • Enable everybody to conceptualize their capabilities as APIs


API Journey Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

API Journey Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

API Journey Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(11) Journey Goals

  • Allow new value to be created by unlocking existing capabilities
  • Allow value to be retained by quickly adapting to changes
  • Allow risk to be reduced by more easily reconfiguring value chains
  • → Improve the organization's building block culture and practice
    • Every and any capability is designed and conceived as an API
    • Use APIs as a faster and more resilient way to build capabilities

(14) This is GraphQL



What is an API? What is an API Product? Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(15) API Products are Products

  • Products have consumers and should drive organizational value
  • API Products are a special kind of product with additional constraints
    • More a service than a (physical) product
    • Many APIs are not (directly) consumed by external consumers
    • API products are the used for composing digital value chains


What is an API? What is an API Product? Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(16) Product Marketing Mix: 4 Ps

  • Framework for decision-making for product marketing
    • Product: Good or service wanted by consumers
    • Price: What are consumers willing to pay for the product?
    • Place: How to make products available to consumers
    • Promotion: How to make consumers aware of products


What is an API? What is an API Product? Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(17) Expanded Product Marketing Mix: 7 Ps

  • Extends the 4 Ps [Product Marketing Mix: 4 Ps (1)] with a focus on services
  • Framework for decision-making for services marketing
    • People: Considerations regarding service consumers (UX/CX)
    • Process: Planning and managing service delivery
    • Physical Evidence: (Physical) context of service delivery

(19) What is a Product?



Why APIs? Microproducts! Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(20) What is Digital Transformation?

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]


Why APIs? Microproducts! Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(21) Goal #1: Flexibility

  • Build new products and services out of existing building blocks
  • Contribute new capabilities as building blocks to the platform
  • Improve solution space by making all capabilities available for reuse


Why APIs? Microproducts! Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(22) Goal #2: Velocity

  • Reduce coordination overhead by making capabilities readily consumable
  • Avoid duplication of effort by always exposing capabilities for reuse
  • Reduce the time needed for digital building block management


Why APIs? Microproducts! Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(23) Microproducts

DX Matters Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(25) Useful and Usable API Products

  • Most APIs are not conceived and marketed as direct products
  • Most API value is realized through API-enabling valuable capabilities
  • Two main factors drive the potential of an API
    1. Is the API useful?
    2. Is the API usable?


DX Matters Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(26) Competing API Products

  • The same useful capability is available by various providers
  • Switching cost may be relatively low for consumers
  • Investing in Developer Experience (DX) can be a competitive advantage


DX Matters Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(27) Usable API Products

  • Many APIs are about unlocking capabilities and not about competition
  • Usability is important but there is no risk of consumers switching
  • Unlocking User Experience (UX) becomes the main concern of the API

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(29) Establish an API Mindset

  • Everybody understands the fundamentals and value of APIs
  • API consumption means that your transformation is working
  • Everybody designs and builds microproducts for others to consume


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way
